config.question: Which of the following decisions taken by Jackson led to the formation of the Whigs?

choices.content: Jackson’s actions intended to destroy the Bank of the United States
removal of Indians via the Trail of Tears
the decision to expel Calhoun from his cabinet
the decision to appoint Van Buren as designated successor

answer_3.response: Jackson’s decision to withdraw deposits from the Bank attracted oppositions from congressmen. The Senate approved a motion of censure. Jacksonians in the House blocked similar action. The coalition that passed the censure resolution in the Senate provided the nucleus for a new national party—the Whigs.
